Name: Celtic Margarita
Ingredients: 7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
RIM glass with salt (moisten outside edge with lime or orange juice and dip into salt).
Review: A Scotch Margarita - try it, it works.
History: Discovered in 2004 at Milk & Honey, London, England. A variant of the popular Margarita cocktail . A detailed history, along with other variants can be found on our page.
Nutrition: One serving of Celtic Margarita contains 179 calories
